main event: A pilot aboard the Lunar Orbiter spacecraft observed one white light in the Atlantic Ocean, 600 miles northwest of Ascension Island, on June 8, 1964.
interesting points: The object appeared similar to a star and was observed about 100 miles away,The light was stable and almost stationary during the 5-minute observation,The object exhibited rapid acceleration and deceleration as well as extreme maneuverability,The object's speed was estimated to be 3-4 times the speed of sound,The object was recorded as silvery-grey and could not be determined to be a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object.
witness description: Pilot Oglesby of the Lunar Orbiter spacecraft
